Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2007 12:10PM Dottie123 wrote: Dear Libby, I know what you mean about wishing for clear answers.  I was diagnosed 7/3/07 DCIS initially thought to be low grade, but revised to intermediate grade.  On biopsy they thought the area of DCIS was very small, but after having a lumpectomy and 2 wider excisions when the pathology reports did not come back with clear margins, it turns out the DCIS was quite extensive.  Prior to being diagnosed, I had thought of the decision as lumpectomy vs. mastectomy.  I had no idea that lumpectomy could actually mean several surgeries.  After 3 surgeries I am still possibly facing a mastectomy.  I certainly hope that your situation will be much more straight forward, that your surgery will be a complete success and your recovery speedy!

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2008 04:16PM - edited Apr 9, 2008 04:17PM by Dottie123 I just got home from the hospital following a left mastectomy on 4/7 with no immediate reconstruction.  I spent 2 nites.  The drain is still in.  I feel fine.  I was amazed not to have had any discomfort at all!  The sentinel node biopsy was not difficult either.  I hope all goes as well for you.  Wishing you good luck and perhaps more importantly- good docs & good meds!
